TopicTitle: ScanSat, USI Kolonisation, RemoteTech and the M700

Articles.Content:
Are there any known issues with the stock M700 scanner when using RemoteTech, ScanSat and Kolonisation?  I already had a Scan Multispectral sensor orbiting the Mun, and have launched another Satellite with a Scan Radar Altimetry scanner, Scan SAR scanner, USI planetary survey scanner, and the stock M4435 and M700 scanners.  It's in a 92 degree orbit at  150km.  When I tell the M700 to scan I get a message saying the DTS-M1 is transmitting data (RemoteTech says I have got comms), but I don't get the toggle overlay button, and the M4435 and planetary survey scanner both say there's no orbital survey data.  Any ideas before I start uninstalling mods to work out what's going on?

 

ETA: put a test satellite up in a fresh install with just an M700, added USI, KAS, KIS, KER and ScanSat.  Scanner works fine.  Add in Remote Tech and I had to launch a new satellite as I couldn't talk to the old one, but it doesn't work.  I'm sure I've used it with RemoteTech on previous versions though,

 

 

Edited January 26, 2016 by RizzoTheRat
This is a known issue with remotetech. There is a community fix available in remotetech's thread.
Thanks, only figured out what mod was causing it late last night, I'll have a trawl through the RemoteTech thread for a fix.

I may be way off here, but I just read this post, that seems might be a similar issue to using SCANSat, M700, & RT together...???

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/121397-105-beta-pathfinder-097-geoscience-for-better-resource-extraction/&do=findComment&comment=2381906
